author: Staff Reporter
text:
Booths will be set up additionally at the toll plazas

The Health Department aims to cover a total of 3,79,496 children aged 0 to 5 years in the first phase of the intensified pulse polio immunisation campaign on January 17.

The department is setting up a total of 2,393 booths across Vellore district to administer the drops to the children.

Like last year, booths will be set up additionally at the toll plazas on the National Highway – 46.

The booths will be established at all bus terminals, railway stations and hills that had poor transport facilities, a press release said.

The booths will be opened from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. to facilitate the public.

Special booths

Special booths will be organised to reach out to children of migrant workers belonging to neighbouring districts and States.

This includes those involved in construction work, doll sellers and Sri Lankan Tamil refugees.

A total of 9,466 staff and 290 supervisors from various departments including the public health, education, social welfare, revenue and NGOs and women Self Help Groups have been involved in the campaign.

Public health officials were particular that children aged 0 to 5 years should be immunised in the campaign even if they had received the drops earlier.

The drops are safe and does not have any side effects, officials said in the release.
title: Over 3 lakh children to be covered in pulse polio campaign
